_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary:

Sunridge Nurseries is committed to the ongoing safety of: our employees, our community, and the 

environment.  To satisfy this requirement, Sunridge Nurseries has instituted a program that 

includes: good management practices, up-to-date operating procedures, regularly-scheduled 

equipment inspection and maintenance, hazard analysis, and the proper safety training for our 

employees.



Regulated Substances:

The only regulated substance held by Sunridge Nurseries is annhydrous ammonia (CAS# 7664-41-7) 

for use in our cold storage refrigeration units.  The total amount held by the receiver tank is 

1647 gallons, or 28048.41 pounds.



Release Prevention/Emergency Response:

With this program, it is the intention of Sunridge Nurseries to fully comply with the Emergency 

Planning and Community Right-to-Know ACT (EPCRA), SS302.  Sundridge Nurseries has instituted an 

Emergency Action Plan that instructs employees on their actions in case of an accidental or 

unauthorized release of anhydrous ammonia.  Training on these procedures is given upon the 

initial hire of an employee and at least annually thereafter.  Additionally, daily visual inspec-

tions will be made of all compressor pressure and temperature readings.  Once every six months

a visual inspection will be made of all process piping and equipment.  Repairs to the equipment

will only be made using parts approved for use in conjunction with anhydrous ammonnia by the 

manufacturer.  



Five Year Accident History:

This facility was newly constructed in 1994 and has not had any unauthorized or accidental 

releases to date.



Emergency Response:

In the event of an unauthorized or accidental release at this facility, the priority of onsite

employees is to evacuate the area.  Steve Maniaci, Abel Martinez, or other designated supervisors

will call the Kern County Fire Department (9-1-1) and Hal Crumly, Inc.  Sunridge Nurseries does not maintain an

emergency on-site responder.
